fields.description: Document the process to release bamboo in case a new version is required for studio.
fields.summary: Document Bamboo release process
Remove visibility of Git/BitBucket from Bamboo config screen

It would be better to disable the Start Import button until a file is selected, and/or provide a friendly error message.

Same thing with the "Select Attachments" step:

fields.description:
When a group such as "jira-users" is assigned to an issue level in an Issue Security Scheme in JIRA, the group is not updated to "users" after the import. Hence, issues that were previously visible to all users become visible to none.

!IssueSecurityLevels.png!
fields.summary: Issues importer does not update Issue Security Scheme groups
JIRA issues macro with applink server parameter does not work
Timeout while setting FishEye permissions during import breaks the whole import process

fields.description:
Studio ships with the Confluence Page Portlet bundled. This is unsupported, unmaintained, and apparently has some major known issues (e.g., AOD-2443, AOD-1607).

We should remove this from Studio, but in order to avoid breaking any existing uses of it, we should:

# Ensure that the Confluence Page Gadget (provided by default by Confluence) is configured in JIRA's list of gadgets by default
# Check to see if anyone is using the old portlet
# If so, write an upgrade task to migrate portlet instances to the supported gadget
fields.summary: Replace the Confluence Page Portlet with the Confluence Page Gadget

fields.description: The JIRA Calendar Plugin is bundled with JIRA Studio, but it is hidden under the "System Plugins" section. It is not actually a system plugin (i.e., a "plugin" that is actually essential to the functioning of the system) so it should show in the main list of plugins, and customer admins should be able to disable it if desired.
fields.summary: JIRA Calendar Plugin appears under "System Plugins"
Make global admin decorator to find out currently selected web item from meta tag

This test failed with the error "Unable to find link with id [agentsConfig]" on the following two builds (in both the "Simple" and "Gapps Simple" build jobs). I suspect that this is because the agentsConfig link no longer exists in the new version of bamboo, but need to confirm.

https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/JST-AOD-250
https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/JST-AOD-251

I have modified the test to comment out the check for this link. This can be removed permanently if/when we confirm that this link is no longer present.

fields.description:
Currently subversion access is open globally, introducing both internal and external security threats against source code while stored in Jira Studio. 

It would be ideal if we could provide a whitelist of IP addresses for access to subversion (and ultimately git, when added). 

This setting would allow us to lock down subversion access to within our VPN or to specific developer IPs when working remotely.
fields.summary: Subversion Security Whitelist

fields.summary: Maven hang on BEAC build

fields.description:
The following build job was hung for several hours before it was manually killed:
  https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/JST-JST-AGMPTEST-238

The jira thread dump and the build and jira logs are attached.
fields.summary: JIRA hang on BEAC build - possible deadlock

fields.description:
When importing a JIRA import file where the default language is not English (such as the attached file, where it is set to French), Studio's behaviour is inconsistent:

* Some UI text is shown in French but most is in English.
* The user profile language selection only shows the French option (no English).
* The General Configuration admin page shows the setting as French, but when you edit any value on the page, it silently changes to English.

If we support non-English languages in Studio, we should retain these settings.
If we only support English in Studio, we should correctly overwrite the values to English and behave consistently.
fields.summary: Language settings behave inconsistently in the issues importer

fields.description:
Now that we have Bamboo 3.0.x on trunk we need a version of the Streams libraries with full support for Bamboo enabled, the current 4.0-rc5 doesn't have Bamboo on the list of providers.
See https://studio.atlassian.com/source/cru/CR-STRM-734.
fields.summary: Release a version of Streams with support for Bamboo enabled

I am not sure whether this is a Header issue or a Bamboo issue. It seems that after the merge of Bamboo branch (stream4) to trunk, the "Create Plans" link is missing from the Bamboo header. I still managed to create the first build plan, because before any plan has been created in Studio, the dashboard page gives a "Create Plan" button which I can use to bring up the UI to create the build plan, but once the first plan has been created, I don't seem to be able to find a way to create more plans, because the "Create Plans" link is missing from the header.

fields.summary: Flaky Test - TestCustomTabs.testCreateCustomTabWithUrlWithoutProtocol

fields.description:
This happens to the released version (May) as well. It seems that the "Bamboo instance name" on the "General Configuration" admin page cannot be changed. Although the new value seems to persist after clicking the "Save" button, once we revisit the page, the old value comes back. (I didn't figure out where this value is being used though.)
!instance-name.png!
fields.summary: Bamboo: "General Configuration" admin page doesn't persist changes

fields.description:
This seems to be a legitimate failure introduced by changeset https://studio.atlassian.com/source/changelog/JST?cs=124050 which was fixing some IE css issues.

This test failed on 3 separate builds (gapps simple and simple on the main JST build, and simple on the bamless build).

https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/JST-JST-SIMPLE-235
https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/JST-JST-GAPPSIMPLE-235
https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/JST-BAMLESS-SIMPLE-231

Can you please look into this and fix if necessary?

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
Please integrate Scroll Enhanced Word Exporter to OnDemand. This will allow OnDemand users to generate superior Word files.
fields.summary: Integrate Scroll Office in OnDemand

fields.description:
Split from AOD-4375. First found in Tempo 6.0.3, still present in 6.1.1.

There are two options to "Log Work". One looks to be provided by the tempo plugin, one by the standard JIRA time tracking. This might indicate the tempo plugin didn't correctly override the JIRA item.
fields.summary: Tempo: there are two "Log Work" links when viewing an issue.

fields.description:
Split from AOD-4375. First found in Tempo 6.0.3, still present in 6.1.1.

Many of the items in the issue action dropdown on the timesheet report do nothing when clicked.

Menu items that do nothing:
- Link
- Clone
- Labels
- Attach Files
- Log Work (second one)

Menu items that work fine:
- Attach Screenshot
- Move
- Watchers/Voters
- Log Work (first one)
- Assign to Me
- Edit/View Issue
- Issue transitions
fields.summary: Tempo: many of the items in the issue action dropdown on the timesheet report do nothing when clicked.

fields.description:
These issues are carried forwards from AOD-4375 and are not specific to 6.1.1 (they existed beforehand, at least since 6.0.3).
- In IE7, some drop-down menu contain gapps between menu items.
- In IE7, the arrow for the Issue dropdown on the Issue Report page overlaps the issue key.
- In IE7, when the "please wait" spinner is visible, the full-screen drop-shadow is only a slim bar at the top of the screen.
- In IE7, "Split Worklog" form fields don't line up.
fields.summary: UI issues in IE7 with Tempo 6.1.1
Redesign JIRA Studio Issues Importer
Option to turn on JIRA Issue Importer for 'admins'

fields.description:
There were 3 elastic instances + agents running and they were all idle. These instances are all based on the same image configuration. Inspection of the 3 agents shows that all of them have the capability of Maven 2.1 and JDK 1.6. However, when configuring a build job, the "Requirements" page only showed 1 agent in the "Matching Elastic Image Configurations" column, although there were actually 3 agents meeting the requirements. This seems to be preventing the concurrent builds from running. The "concurrent build" option has been enabled on the server level, but the builds were stilling running sequentially. (They did run on different agents each time, just not concurrently.)

Please see below a (huge) screenshot showing the observation.
!multiple-agents.png!
fields.summary: Bamboo 3.0: build plan only sees one agent, blocking concurrent build

fields.summary: Upgraded of plugin com.atlassian.studio-repository-manager-jira-plugin to version 1 fails with message: Unable to read repository permissions file

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
We would like to request JIRA studio support for integration with HP Quality Center using the JIRA Bridge for HP QC solution from Orasi Software.  Plugin details are located here:  http://www.orasi.com/products/Pages/Orasi.aspx.  Also, on Atlassian Plugin exchange:  https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/26467

I clicked on a link to a review from my email and I got a nice stack trace (attached)

When I went directly to studio.atlassian.com and logged in there, the link to Cru started working properly.

fields.description:
The JIRA Suite Utilities plugin is initially installed but disabled in Studio. Customer admins have the ability to enable the plugin.

When the plugin has been enabled, it appears to load correctly:
!JSUEnabled.png!

However, any attempts to configure a Workflow Condition, Validator or Post Function that is supplied by this plugin (such as the "User Is In Any Groups" condition) result in the following error:

While attemping to import the attached file, the import fails with the following error.
Subsequently, no users can log into Studio, not even the build-in sysadmin user.

The import data was exported from JIRA 4.3.3 and is pretty simple - three users, one project, no issues.

I have had success with other import files, haven't yet worked out why this is different.

fields.summary: JIRA import can fail and locks all users out of Studio

fields.description:
JIM importer allows users to import data into their JIRA instance. Amongst other things it can do csv

https://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1877279730

If we had a customer facing JIM importer in studio, we could convert more people from other products and reduce load for support team on csv imports.
fields.summary: Customer facing JIM importer

fields.description:
In Bamboo build log, there is following error regarding artifact copying:

{noformat}
17-May-2011 18:31:39  	Running post build plugin 'Artifact Copier'
17-May-2011 18:31:39 	Publishing artifact Runable Jar
17-May-2011 18:31:40 	Failed to execute plugin 'Artifact Copier' with error: java.io.IOException: Unexpected HTTP status code: 500 Internal Server Error
{noformat}

and the artifacts were not copied successfully. (It was not available for download from the Artifacts page.)

The Maven command line used for this build job was "{{mvn clean package}}", which will generate a couple of jar files (the artifacts) in the {{target}} directory, but none of them were picked. 

Please see attached the test Maven project I used for this test: [^test-project.tar.gz].

This issue doesn't exist in the May release (with Bamboo 2.6), so it looks like it has something to do with the Bamboo upgrade.
fields.summary: Bamboo 3.0: failed to execute 'Artifact Copier' plugin with 500 Internal Server Error

fields.description:
As of now, View -> Excel (All Fields) doesn't export any of the details of the Activity Section of a JIRA.

We are specifically interested in the Source Tab of the Activity Section, as Source tab lists the changeset
details (files checked in corresponding to a JIRA fix).
Kindly add an option in JIRA so that Activity section details of a JIRA can be searched, extracted/exported.
JQL also doesn't list Activity in it's Fields Reference.
This feature is highly desired, as it would let us get the complete export of information associated with a JIRA.
Request you to let us know when can this be made available in JIRA

(Outlook mail thread of Support request raised for this issue is attached)
fields.summary: Activity Section details export option required in JIRA
JIRA Importer failures return the admin to the initial import screen with no error feedback

fields.description:
1. Bring up Studio
2. Go to crowd, add a user into jira application
3. Go to Jira's user directories
4. Click sync
5. The newly added user never comes through to Jira's user browser.

I've tried to debug this. Seems like the sync button in UI successfully calls Quartz to schedule the sync job but the job never gets executed.
As a result of this, any changes made on crowd do not come through to Jira.
fields.summary: crowd synchronization quartz job never gets triggered in jira-studio

fields.description:
While creating a Bamboo 3.0 build plan in Studio by importing a Maven 2 pom, there are 3 options for the repository where the pom is going to be fetched from: Subversion, Mercurial and Git. Since Studio only deals with its own Subversion repository at this stage, we may not want Mercurial and Git to appear in that drop-down menu.

After given a correct Mercurial URL the UI returned an error saying "_Please configure mercurial as a server capability_".
!mercurial_and_git.png!
fields.summary: Bamboo 3.0: May need to hide Mercurial and Git support

fields.description:
After importing some sample data from JIRA using the Studio importer, there were many indications of permission problems:
* No user could not see any of the issues in any projects except the one that was enabled for anonymous access (ARA).
* No users have permission to create issues.
* The Default Assignee (Project Lead) was not assignable for the projects.

The data I used is attached.

The problem appears to be that the project roles for each project were not correctly imported - all the permission settings are otherwise correct.

Here are the project roles as defined in standalone JIRA:
!ImportRoles-JIRA.png!

There are the project roles for the same project in Studio:
!ImportRoles-Studio.png!
fields.summary: JIRA project roles are not correctly imported by the Studio importer
